work.title: ... and time is running past midnight ...

composer.name: Victoria Borisova-Ollas
composer.longDescription: Victoria Borisova-Ollas is a Russian-Swedish composer whose work is noted for its emotional depth and cinematic texture. Her compositions frequently explore themes of memory, dream states, and surrealism through atmospheric orchestration and nuanced pacing.
composer.shortDescription: Russian-Swedish composer of textured, emotionally rich contemporary orchestral music.
representativeWorks: ... and time is running past midnight ...

work.shortDescription: A surreal, cinematic orchestral soundscape exploring time, dream, and disquiet.
work.longDescription: Premiered by the Royal Stockholm Philharmonic in 2014, this richly textured orchestral piece evokes a deserted city at night, inviting the listener into a liminal world of altered perception. With shimmering celesta, haunting winds, and ambient percussion, Borisova-Ollas crafts a spellbinding meditation on emotional atmosphere and surreal experience.
work.rawContent:
ORCHESTRAL · ATMOSPHERIC / PROGRAMMATIC

~10 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Full Orchestra (including harp, piano, celesta, and rich percussion)

Mood and Style

Cinematic · Unsettling · Enchanted

insight: Hovering between dream and disquiet, this piece unfolds like the soundtrack to a surreal, late-night encounter. Moody textures, shimmering percussion, and strange beauty make it perfect for listeners craving something unexpected, haunting, and spellbinding.

work.title: D’un soir triste

composer.name: Lili Boulanger
composer.longDescription: Lili Boulanger was a prodigious French composer whose brief life yielded works of striking emotional depth and harmonic sophistication. A student of Fauré and the first woman to win the Prix de Rome, her music blends Impressionist textures with deep expressive power.
composer.shortDescription: French composer of radiant, expressive works that blend Impressionism with emotional depth.

work.shortDescription: A velvet-hued chamber meditation on grief, sensuality, and emotional twilight.
work.longDescription: Composed in the final year of her life, Lili Boulanger’s D’un soir triste is a lush, introspective work scored for a chamber ensemble of piano, harp, strings, horn, and clarinet. Its emotional tone is layered with ambiguity and longing, drawing from Impressionist harmony to build a sound world of suspended beauty and quiet sorrow.
work.rawContent:
CHAMBER ORCHESTRA / LARGE ENSEMBLE

~10 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Piano, Harp, Strings, Horn, Clarinet (also available in full orchestral version)

Mood and Style

Dusky · Lush · Wistful

insight: Boulanger’s final completed work is a glowing, sorrow-tinged meditation in sound. Its velvet harmonies and emotional depth create a sensuous haze — perfect for programs exploring twilight moods and the quiet ache of beauty.
